# Resources

There are multiple resources, including online material and books, to help you become acquainted with R, RStudio, and phylogenetics in R.

R programming:
- [*The R Book*](http://eu.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-0470973927.html) by Mick Crawley

Literate programming and graphics:
- [*Dynamic Documents with R and knitr*](https://www.crcpress.com/product/isbn/9781482203530) by Yihui Xie
- [*ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis*](http://www.springer.com/gp/book/9780387981406) by Hadley Wickham

RStudio:
- [*Learning RStudio for R Statistical Computing*](https://www.packtpub.com/big-data-and-business-intelligence/learning-rstudio-r-statistical-computing) by Mark van der Loo and Edwin de Jonge

Phylogenetics:
- [*Analysis of Phylogenetics and Evolution with R*](http://www.springer.com/gb/book/9781461417422) by Emmanuel Paradis
- [*The Phylogenetic Handbook, Second Edition*](http://www.cambridge.org/gb/academic/subjects/life-sciences/genomics-bioinformatics-and-systems-biology/phylogenetic-handbook-practical-approach-phylogenetic-analysis-and-hypothesis-testing-2nd-edition) edited by Philippe Lemey, Marco Salemi, and Anne-Mieke Vandamme
